natural solution: We begin by writing $\frac{1}{4}$ and $16$ as powers of $2$. \begin{align} (2^{-2})^{2x+8} & = (2^4)^{2x+5} \\ 2^{-4x-16} & = 2^{8x + 20} \\ -4x - 16 & = 8x + 20 \\ x & = \boxed{-3} \end{align}
